displayName.text: Osher Early Learning Center at Chabad of Washington Heights

formattedAddress: 50 Overlook Terrace, New York, NY 10033, USA

authorAttributions.displayName: Osher Early Learning Center at Chabad of Washington Heights
Osher Early Learning Center at Chabad of Washington Heights

adrFormatAddress: 50 Overlook Terrace, New York, NY 10033, USA

originalText.text: We sent our son to Osher for 3 years and loved it. It is amazing how much he thrived there. He always loved going to school and he felt so at home there. He learned so much about Judaism, about working with others, and he developed a love for learning and an intellectual curiosity. As a family we felt embraced by the community. We are so lucky that our son spent his earliest years in the care of the wonderful staff at Osher.

text.text: We sent our son to Osher for 3 years and loved it. It is amazing how much he thrived there. He always loved going to school and he felt so at home there. He learned so much about Judaism, about working with others, and he developed a love for learning and an intellectual curiosity. As a family we felt embraced by the community. We are so lucky that our son spent his earliest years in the care of the wonderful staff at Osher.

originalText.text: My 3 year old daughter has been attending Osher for the past four months.  She is thriving in the environment at Osher.  Over such a short time, she has begun asking bigger, more thoughtful questions and her imaginative play has become more detailed and nuanced.  She has also begun to try and use found objects (such as a paper box) to create new things (such as a fire truck).  Every week at Osher she conducts real, hands-on science experiments.  She often comes home asking if we can replicate the experiments.  For example, one day she asked if we could do experiments with ice at home after trying to see how fast ice would melt at school when it was placed in different temperature liquids.  At Osher, I feel that she is learning through multiple modalities.  For example, she sings, dances, does yoga, paints, plays, builds, listens to stories in both Hebrew and English, and runs outside plenty.  I love that she is so active at school.  I also love that the teachers not only are not afraid to get messy, but they actually encourage messy work.  Painting, sculpting with clay and cooking are the norm there.  My daughter often says she is thankful for her teachers and friends at Osher.  We are, too.

originalText.text: I was lucky to have taught at Osher this past year, I loved going to work! There was something very special and holistic about the environment - encouraging creativity and communication. I'd describe the outlook as "teach each child according to his needs" If I wasn't moving away, I'd love to keep working there, the kids are well taken care of, challenged, and loved.  It's a gem.

originalText.text: Our older son spent three years at Osher, and we are forever in debt to Elisheva and her staff. They truly love the children like their own. Our son has learned so much in his time there, and we have watched him grow and mature by leaps and bounds. We are thrilled that our younger son is now old enough to benefit from the care, dedication and love that make Osher so unique and special.

text.text: Our older son spent three years at Osher, and we are forever in debt to Elisheva and her staff. They truly love the children like their own. Our son has learned so much in his time there, and we have watched him grow and mature by leaps and bounds. We are thrilled that our younger son is now old enough to benefit from the care, dedication and love that make Osher so unique and special.

originalText.text: Osher ELC, under the direction of Elisheva Kirschenbaum, proved to be the most wonderful, nurturing, and stimulating environment for our son. Elisheva and her team of devoted, creative, and concerned teachers provided support, love, and guidance for our son, who thrived there for two years. Osher was truly like sending our son to an extended family each day. I should mention that each day they in provide a healthy lunch and snacks, so no packing lunches! I cannot say enough good things about Osher.
